title: Sierra Space lays off hundreds in push toward first Dream Chaser spaceplane launch
summary: Sierra Space, one of the sector’s most valuable private companies, laid off several hundred employees and contractors this week, CNBC has learned.

title: Lockheed Martin to demonstrate space-based 5G network
summary: Lockheed Martin announced Nov. 16 it plans to launch a satellite to demonstrate 5G fiber-like connectivity  from low-Earth orbit.

title: OHB, feeling undervalued, going private in deal with KKR
summary: The chief executive of European space company OHB says taking the company private is necessary in a time when small companies, specifically space companies, are undervalued in public markets.

title: Norway buys Telenor’s satellite business to expand space ambitions
summary: Norwegian state-run telco Telenor announced plans Nov. 16 to sell its satellite division to Space Norway, part of the country’s space agency, in a deal worth around $216 million.

title: Investing in Space: Deutsche Bank draws investors, companies for NYC for summit
summary: Yesterday Deutsche Bank held a Space Summit conference here in New York City. On the sidelines, CNBC filmed interviews with more than a half dozen senior executives from Rocket Lab to Mynaric and more.

title: UPDATE! SpaceX Starship Almost Ready For Launch
summary: Liftoff is currently scheduled for Saturday, November 18th after Elon stated that one of Booster 9’s grid fin actuators needed to be replaced.

title: SpaceX Starship launch delayed one day, Elon Musk reveals
summary: SpaceX Starship Integrated Flight Test 2 has been delayed 24 hours to no earlier than Saturday, November 18th, with the 20-minute launch...

title: Firms are tackling challenges to unlock the potential of hyperspectral imagery
summary: Companies engaged in hyperspectral satellite imagery are beginning to overcome challenges to unlocking its potential, according to industry experts.

title: Amazon says its first Project Kuiper internet satellites were fully successful in testing
summary: A little over a month after launch, Amazon on Thursday announced its pair of prototype internet satellites were fully successfully in operations and testing.

title: Project Kuiper ready for satellite production after successful prototype tests
summary: Commercial Project Kuiper satellites are entering production next month without design changes after two recently launched prototypes aced end-to-end tests, the broadband constellation’s vice president of technology said in an interview.
